thread.title: Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery
thread.title_full: Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery

title: Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery
text:
Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery Rangers third baseman Adrian Beltre had successful surgery on his injured left thumb Friday in Los Angeles. Post to Facebook Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery Rangers third baseman Adrian Beltre had successful surgery on his injured left thumb Friday in Los Angeles.   WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1S1LnGb   Join the Conversation To   Adrian Beltre has successful thumb surgery Landon Haaf, WFAA Sports 9:51 p.m. CDT October 23, 2015 Adrian Beltre during the 2015 ALDS (Photo: Nick Turchiaro-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Rangers third baseman Adrian Beltre had successful surgery on his injured left thumb Friday in Los Angeles. 
The procedure removed scar tissue from the thumb, which had been injured since Beltre injured a ligament in his thumb during Texas’ May 31 game at Boston. 
Beltre is expected to be ready for 2016 Spring Training, the club said in a Friday release. Rangers' Beltre played with torn ligament in thumb 
The future Hall-of-Famer went on the disabled list from June 1-22, but didn’t miss additional time despite having the ligament damage in his thumb. 
"The prevailing opinion was 'rest'. But that's not really in his vocabulary,” GM Jon Daniels said in the team’s postseason press conference. “So, he played through what ideally he would've had more time to let cool off." 
Beltre hit .287 with 18 home runs and 83 RBI in the 2015 season, including a .305 average with 12 homers and 65 RBI after his June 23 return from the DL. 
He left Game 1 of the American League Division Series with stiffness in his back. After missing the next two games, Beltre talked his way back into the lineup and returned for Games 4 and 5, recording three hits over the final two games of the Rangers' season.
